comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably from October 1911 (perhaps October 5), according to query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A06E4DA1E3EE033A... which mentions the Varese. "SHELLED TRIPOLI TWO DAYS.; Italians Then Landed and Blew Up Forts -- Turkish Shells Fell Short. === Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES. October 9, 1911, Monday LONDON, Oct. 8. -- The cable between Tripoli and Malta having been restored, telegrams are now coming to hand from that quarter. The following message, dated Tripoli, Sunday, 4:25 P. M., sent to The Daily Mail, is the first out of Tripoli for eight days: ... ===

comment._content:
